result.execSummary:
The defendant David A King was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).
  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500 [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500 [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500 [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Criminal Damage to Property [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).
  • Criminal Damage to Property [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Pay costs including the DNA surcharge. Pay within 60 days or you will need to set up a payment plan today.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes: Huber if approved by jail administration. Defendant is eligible for Electronic Monitoring if approved by the risk assessment and jail administration. First half served in jail and 2nd half on electronic monitor.

miscConds.notes: Obtain and maintain full-time employment or be enrolled in and attend school full time, or a combination of both resulting in full time.

Obtain diploma, HSED or GED.
Letter to all victims, give to agent first written within 45 days.
No contact with all victims listed in the complaints including read-in victims, except for the letter of apology.
No contact with all co-defendants, EAM and CGR.
Early discharge, if successfully completes and Agent recommends.

Pay costs, surcharges and DNA surcharges.   If probation is discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 25% of gross.

Court will set the matter for sentencing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 24, 2017 at 04:00 pm.

Restitution summary for 15CF112 - Defendant's amount due
Restitution Summary (15CF111 $600 to be collected through probation on case #15CF112)
Count 1

11:34 a.m. Defendant David A. King in court with attorney Erik John Mcfarland. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Cases 15CF112, 15CF111 and 14CM311 being heard today.
Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement. 15CF112 ct 1 - Deferred Judgment. 15CF112 cts 2, 3, 4, 11, & 12 I/S sentence 9 mo jail -stay and 3 yr probation w/conditions.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: 15CF112 Counts 1, 2, 3, 4, 11, and 12 - No contest

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty 15CF112 Counts 1, 2, 3, 4, 11, and 12 .  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date. 
15CF111, 14CM311, 15CF112 Counts 5, 6, 7, 8, 9, 10, and 13 are dismissed and read in.

ADA Knaapen makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty McFarland concurs with joint recommendation.  

BY THE COURT:****PROBATION***** 
15CF112 Count 1: Deferred Pros
15CF112 Cts 2
I/S Sentence - 9 mo jail w/huber first half in jail and 2nd half on EM, if approved by Risk Assessment.
36 months   Probation, concurrent

Obtain diploma, HSED or GED.

No contact with all co-defendants, EAM and CGR.
Pay restitution of 15CF112 $414.93 and for 15CF111 $600.00.

Pay costs, surcharges and DNA surcharges.
